Package AI31

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • AI31.UserInterface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AI31Constants, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class UserInterface
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements AI31Constants
    This class is the class that runs all of the game information between players and components.
    Made by Dong-Yon Kim. Please do NOT claim or publish this without my written permission.
    Do you want written permission? Email me: dongyonkim5@gmail.com.
    Enjoy and use this for personal reasons as much as you want! Just don't publish it please. Any questions? Email them to me and I'll take a look. Make sure to have fun...

    NOTE: All Javadoc information is given for global variables and methods. No Javadoc information for local variables. Future long term goal: Overhaul the UI and make it look a lot nicer, with a background and cards in different locations. The above would work with up to 6 players and at a minimum of 2. A possible animation would be drag the card over. But how would I do that? I could though drag my card with the middle card and have that replace the two.
    Since:
    1.1
    Version:
    10.1
    Author:
    dykim
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • startingPlayerSet

        protected boolean startingPlayerSet
        Is the starting player set or not? If not, one custom game mode will default it.

      • defaultGame

        protected boolean defaultGame
        Whether this game is a default game or not. Basically, a default game takes you straight in - randomizes AI name and player name What determines a default game? When the number of times buttons have been pressed is exactly ONE

      • actionCount

        protected int actionCount
        How many non-timer actions?

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInterface

        public UserInterface()
              throws PlayingCardException,
                     GameErrorException
        Creates the game. It's that simple.
        Throws:
        PlayingCardException - if something goes wrong setting up the playing cards
        GameErrorException - if something goes wrong while playing the game

      • UserInterface

        public UserInterface​(boolean info)
        Deprecated.
        An old constructor for UserInterface, primarily for testing purposes. DO NOT USE.
        Parameters:
        info - - this boolean means absolutely nothing at all

        protected int askPlayerCount()
        Deprecated.
        As of v.4.0, this method is no longer being used.
        DO NOT USE. This method has been replaced by the sliders at the top of the screen.
        Returns:
        the number of players that you want to play with

      • displayException

        public static void displayException​(java.lang.Exception e,
                                    int location)
        Displays an exception and what you normally would see in the console as a result of said exception in dialog boxes.
        Parameters:
        e - - the Exception you want to display
        location - - where the Exception occured (which class?)
        0: UserInterface
        1: UserPanel
        2: CustomFrame
        3: Player
        4: PlayingCard, and
        5: Other.

      • displayOptions

        public static int displayOptions​(java.lang.Object body,
                                 java.lang.Object[] selection,
                                 java.lang.String title)
        Displays the Object in a pop up dialog and asks for specific information, based on the selection array.
        Parameters:
        body - - the Object the user wants to display as a JOptionPane
        selection - - the option choices for the buttons of the JOptionPane
        title - - the title of the message
        Returns:
        an integer representing the chosen option from the array

      • displayOptions

        public static int displayOptions​(java.lang.Object body,
                                 java.lang.String title)
        Displays the Object in a pop up dialog and asks for specific information.
        Parameters:
        body - - the Object the user wants to display as a JOptionPane
        title - - the title of the message
        Returns:
        an integer representing the chosen button (2 for cancel, 0 for yes, 1 for no)

      • displayYesNo

        public static int displayYesNo​(java.lang.Object body,
                               java.lang.String title)
        See Also:
        Note that the conditions and return values are exactly the same as: AI31.UserInterface#displayOptions(Object, String). The only difference: This function's buttons are titled YES, NO, and CANCEL, not OK and CANCEL.

        protected void setUpGUI()
        Sets up the visible UI components to use for playing the game.
        Throws:
        GUISetUpException - - if something goes wrong while setting up the game

      • setUpInformation

        protected void setUpInformation()
        Sets up all necessary arrays and information for the game.

      • startGame

        protected void startGame()
        This function adds the names of the AIs for the game to reference. The player can decide what the names will be, or can let the game decide.

      • setUpSinglePlayer

        protected void setUpSinglePlayer()
        Sets up the game for one human player.

      • startLocalMultiPlayer

        protected void startLocalMultiPlayer()
        Sets up the game for multiple human players.

      • startCustom

        protected void startCustom()
        Creates the CustomModeFrame to obtain information on how to set the game up (special settings?).

      • setUpCustom

        protected void setUpCustom()
        Sets up custom mode, where you can change almost anything but the size of each player's hand.

      • setUpDefaultGame

        protected void setUpDefaultGame()
        Sets up the default game. You (the player) have the name Player and the Ai names are random.

      • addCustomPlayers

        protected void addCustomPlayers()
        Essentially sets up the players in a custom settings game.

      • checkName

        protected boolean checkName​(java.lang.String name)
        Ensures no duplicate human names exist. Enter a name for this to check and it will return whether the name is used or not (through human names).
        Parameters:
        name - - the name you want to check
        Returns:
        true if the name is not used, false if it is used

      • checkAI

        protected boolean checkAI​(java.lang.String name)
        Ensures no duplicate human names exist. Enter a name for this to check and it will return whether the name is used or not (through AI names).
        Parameters:
        name - - the name you want to check
        Returns:
        true if the name is not used, false if it is used

      • checkAll

        protected boolean checkAll​(java.lang.String name)
        Essentially a combination of the methods checkName(String) and checkAI(name). Ensures no duplicate names exist. Enter a name for this to check and it will return whether the name is used or not.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name you want to check
        Returns:
        true if the name is not used, false if it is used

      • generateName

        protected java.lang.String generateName()
        Generates a random name from the AI names and checks to ensure no duplicate names.
        Returns:
        a selected name from the ArrayList of player names

      • addAINames

        protected void addAINames()
        The preset possible names of the AIs. Did I miss one? Do you want one added? Email me. (If you know my number, you can text)

      • deal

        protected void deal()
             throws GameErrorException
        Adds the life status to the UI and calls nonRepeatTimer to run once (after the game speed amount of time has passed, the round will begin).
        Throws:
        GameErrorException

      • dealAgain

        protected void dealAgain()
        Continues the deal process and prepares the alive players for the round.

      • doAITurns

        protected void doAITurns()
        Quite frankly calls for each player's turns and detects when the final player of the round has taken their turn, hence the name "doAITurns".

      • doFirstTurn

        protected void doFirstTurn()
        Does the first turn, the dealer's turn. For more information...
        See Also:
        Machine.doDealersTurn(), doFirstHumanTurn()

      • doFirstHumanTurn

        protected void doFirstHumanTurn()
        Does the dealer's turn for a human: Do you want to keep your cards or swap them with the middle three? This does NOT trigger final turn.

      • gameplay

        protected void gameplay()
                 throws GameErrorException
        Each round of gameplay is essentially... one player's turn. Except exceptions are caught.
        Throws:
        GameErrorException - - if a PlayingCardException is thrown

      • processTurns

        protected void processTurns()
                     throws GameErrorException,
                            PlayingCardException
        Essentially processes the turns of each player (takes care of and organizes the results of each player's turn)
        Throws:
        GameErrorException - - if something =goes wrong passing the player's turn or if the player does not make a decision
        PlayingCardException

      • endOfRound

        protected void endOfRound()
        Prints each player's hand and prepares for the end of the round.

      • finishEndOfRound

        protected void finishEndOfRound()
        Removes the lives from the players with the lowest hands, removes the dead players, and organizes the system for the next starting player. It also determines whether the game is over or not. It is the hardest method to code, the most buggy, and the most essential. How wonderful.

      • gameOver

        protected boolean gameOver()
        Determines whether the game is over.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over (all human players or your AI are eliminated),
        false if the game is stll running

      • swapWithMiddle

        protected void swapWithMiddle()
        Swaps the cards of the middle and the cards of the current player.

      • resetHands

        protected void resetHands()
        Resets the player hands.
        Throws:
        PlayingCardException

      • addCards

        protected void addCards()
        Adds the cards to be dealt for the game. If players have specific cards for a set amount of rounds, this will give them the cards. Note that the players must be added BEFORE using this method, otherwise an IndexOutOfBounds exception will run.

      • dealCards

        protected void dealCards()
        Deals the cards out to the players.
        If a player has a preset hand from custom mode, it gives the player the hand and randomizes the remaining cards.
        If not, it gives the player three pseudorandomly selected cards.
        If the "Set Random Suit Quantities" option is selected, random cards are generated per suit quantity, in suit order.

      • generateCard

        protected Card31 generateCard()
        Generates a card from the cards arraylist based on all four suits.
        Returns:
        a randomly selected card from the cards ArrayList

      • generateSuitCard

        protected Card31 generateSuitCard​(int condition)
                           throws GameErrorException
        Generates a random card based on a suit or set of suits, specified by the condition variable.
        0: Spades
        1: Clubs
        2: Hearts
        3: Diamonds
        4: Spades or Clubs
        5: Spades or Hearts
        6: Spades or Diamonds
        7: Clubs or Hearts
        8: Clubs or Diamonds
        9: Hearts or Diamonds
        10: Clubs, Hearts, or Diamonds
        11: Spades, Hearts, or Diamonds
        12: Spades, Clubs, or Diamonds, or
        13: Spades, Clubs, or Hearts.
        Parameters:
        condition - - the number of the choice of suits (which number represents the suits you want?) Let me know if I missed any!
        Throws:
        GameErrorException - if the given condition is invalid or there are no available cards for the given conditions

      • generateSuitCard

        protected Card31 generateSuitCard​(java.lang.String suit,
                                  java.lang.String... suits)
                           throws GameErrorException
        Generates a random card based on a suit or set of suits, specified by the suit and suits varaiables.
        Parameters:
        suit - - the first suit you want to add
        suits - - all the remaining suits you want to add
        Returns:
        a card that matches the specified suit
        Throws:
        GameErrorException - - if there are no available cards given the selected suit

      • cardCount

        protected int cardCount​(java.lang.String suit)
        How many available cards per suit are there?
        Parameters:
        suit - - what suit do you want to check?
        Returns:
        the number of cards in that suit

      • nextPlayer

        protected void nextPlayer()
        Ends the current player's turn and beings the next player's turn. If this is the final turn, it removes the player from the list of alive players for the round.

      • moveTurnCounter

        protected void moveTurnCounter()
        Changes the turn counter (dealer's turn (1) to normal turn (0) to final turn (-1)).

      • shuffle

        protected <T> T[] shuffle​(T[] info)
        Shuffles the given array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the reference object of the array
        Parameters:
        info - 0- the array that is intended to be shuffled
        Returns:
        a shuffled copy of the array

        a deep copy of the Middle hand (not the same object)

      • updateTimer

        protected void updateTimer​(int ms)
        Updates the speed of the repeating timer (how fast between calls?)
        Parameters:
        ms - - how long it takes between method pings (the shorter the speed the shorter the delay)

      • startOrEndTimer

        protected void startOrEndTimer​(boolean sOE)
        Starts or ends the timer based on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        sOE - - true if you want to restart the timer, false to end the timer

      • startOrEndNonRepeatTimer

        protected void startOrEndNonRepeatTimer​(boolean sOE)
        Starts or ends the non repeating timer. The only difference: this will affect the non-repeating timer, not the repeating timer
        Parameters:
        sOe - - true if the game is starting and you want to restart the timer, false if you want to end the game.
        See Also:
        startOrEndTimer(boolean)

      • updateNonRepeatTimer

        protected void updateNonRepeatTimer​(int ms)
        Updates the speed of the non repeating timer. Note that this applies for the non-repeating timer, not the repeating timer.
        Parameters:
        ms - - the amount (in milliseconds) the timer will run for
        See Also:
        updateTimer(int)

      • setMode

        protected void setMode​(java.lang.String mode)
        Sets the game mode and checks for custom mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - - the gamemode you want the game to be in

        DO NOT use this method without knowing the human counts - how many humans? 1? Everyone? Between 1 and everyone?
        Just a reminder:
        "competition" means single player
        "friendly" means every non-mid Player is a human
        "combination" means some AIs, some humans

      • setPlayerCount

        protected void setPlayerCount​(int ct)

        ct - - the number of players
